results.title: The Black Hood Strikes
results.brief_description: Winner in the Middle Animation category. Priceless jewels were stolen from a rich family during their fancy ball. It’s the BLACK HOOD!’ Only the local private investigator can get to the bottom of this terrible crime and find the Black Hood before he flees the country and it’s too late. Will he stop him, will he survive, will he run out of fuel and who is the BLACK HOOD? So many questions, it’s a mystery.

results.title: Amazing Mums
results.brief_description: A Winner in the Junior Live Action category of Screen It 2016. Have you ever wondered how your mum fits so much into a day? Well so has Sarah! Join her as she tries to figure out the mystery that is her mums schedule and how she could possibly fit so much into one day… she might just find out more than she bargained for!

results.title: ACMI Presents: A Life Exposed: Robyn Beeche
results.brief_description: The 2013 documentary “A Life Exposed” (directed by Lesley Branagan) explores the life and work of Australian photographer Robyn Beeche. In this ACMI event, writer and former editor of Vogue Australia, Kirstie Clements, leads a discussion between Beeche and Branagan.

results.title: The Good, the bad and the noodley
results.brief_description: Business is booming for Ninja Noodle which means business is bad for The Grubby Gruel. After the noodle shop is raided by the town bad apple, the good Shinobi must battle against the odds to return his secret sauce to its rightful place. East meets west in a noodle-filled western caper.

results.title: George and his groaning mouth
results.brief_description: George complains so much he is disliked by everyone he meets. One day, while he’s whinging as usual, his mouth falls off. He is rushed to the doctor but even medical experts can’t help him. George has to cope with problems holding his mouth in his hand causes. Finally he realises he has to change his complaining ways and become a better person.

results.title: The Goal
results.brief_description: Meet Bella, a soccer obsessed ten year old. She eats, breathes and dreams soccer. There’s just one problem. She would rather eat junk food while watching a match on TV than actually play the game herself. When a freak accident occurs, everyone mistakes her for a soccer superstar. However, due to her lack of soccer skills she fails miserably. Will she change her attitude towards exercise or remain a couch potato forever?

results.title: David Bowie is becoming a Medium
results.brief_description: Speaking to the BBC in 1976, Bowie claimed that his career was built on the desire to “be the instigator of new ideas….to turn people on to new things and new perspectives…to be that sort of catalytic kind of thing.“ He described rock music as a medium through which he could achieve this impact and speculated that he would move from using rock in this way to becoming a medium himself, saying, “hopefully that’ll happen one day…that’s really why I do it…to become a medium.” This talk takes Bowie’s characteristically self-aware and oblique statement as a starting point for an exploration of his extraordinary creative impact and cultural status. Sharing insights gained during the making of ‘David Bowie is’ at the V&A, it explains how the exhibition was devised to perpetuate the catalytic and inspirational power of Bowie’s art, style and music. Presented by Dr Kathryn Johnson, Assistant Curator for the ‘David Bowie is’ Exhibition from the V&A Museum.

results.title: Filming Miss Fisher at the Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne
results.brief_description:
Tim Entwisle, Director and CEO of the Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne, introduces the history of the Gardens and Observatory buildings, discussing their initial development in the ‘Marvellous Melbourne’ of the gold rush, and their place in Melbourne’s social and intellectual life.
Tim also recounts the story of the infamous serial killings that took place in the Gardens in the 1920s.

results.title: 100 Pages
results.brief_description: ‘100 Pages’ is a project based upon the theme of North Sydney Girls High School’s Centenary. This project used the School’s identity and history as inspiration for artmaking. Through the artmaking, students are celebrating the school’s identity in the present and past community; isolating individual events, subjects and objects as inspiration. The title of the unit, ‘100 Pages’, comes from the initial idea of 100 animations, for 100 years of history. This project has been developed for the Stage 5 elective, Year 10 Photography and Digital Media class (PDM), which comprises 12 students from North Sydney Girls High School.
